result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:33 AM Defendant Justin Alexander Vance appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier in court for Justin Alexander Vance.  Attorney Emmeline Lee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Justin Alexander Vance in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Joseph Freier. Defendant to reimburse the County $50 per month.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:07 PM   Defendant Justin Alexander Vance appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wants to represent himself and enter a no contest plea.  Matter to be set.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Robert Vance appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1000 Signature Bond with conditions: Not to possess any dangerous weapons or firearms. Absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond anytime between Wednesday, August 17 and Friday, August 19, 2022. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM
Not to possess any dangerous weapons or firearms. Absolute sobriety.
